comments.body: the backticks in python 2 are equivalent to calling the `repr()` [function ](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/What-does-the-repr-function-do-in-Python-Object-Oriented-Programming) which returns a string out of the result of the `print()` call. I'm nt sure why this was added initially as it has no effect whatsoever
Heh, I'm not sure how that got in there.  Thanks for removing it.
